article: One day something went wrong with a man's bicycle chain . The man could not repair it, so he looked  _  for help. The only house nearby belonged to a woman who had  _  there a few months earlier. The man knocked at the door, but the woman did not answer. The door had clear glass in it, and the man  _  see that the woman was home. He decided to knock again. Finally the woman came to the door. The man immediately explained his  _  . "I can fix the chain," the woman said. Later when the bike was  _  to go, the man said, 'Thanks. I hope I can help you some day." "I never need help," the woman said. The following week the man was riding his bike  _  he noticed the woman walking down the street. A strong wind suddenly lifted her hat and sent it into the branches of an old tree. The woman tried to get her hat with a stick, but she failed. She seemed  _  because she clearly was not dressed for tree-climbing. The man hurried over, quickly climbed up to the hat and  _  it into the woman's waiting hands. When she put on her hat, she  _  the man as he climbed back on his bike. 'I think I told you I never need help," the woman said, "I'm glad you didn't  _  me. Thanks." Then they both smiled.
